get.summary:
lncli: `wtclient towers`
ListTowers returns the list of watchtowers registered with the client.

parameters.name: include_sessions
parameters.description: Whether we should include sessions with the watchtower in the response.

parameters.name: exclude_exhausted_sessions
parameters.description:
Whether to exclude exhausted sessions in the response info. This option
is only meaningful if include_sessions is true.

post.summary:
lncli: `wtclient add`
AddTower adds a new watchtower reachable at the given address and
considers it for new sessions. If the watchtower already exists, then
any new addresses included will be considered when dialing it for
session negotiations and backups.

get.summary:
lncli: `wtclient tower`
GetTowerInfo retrieves information for a registered watchtower.

parameters.name: pubkey
parameters.description: The identifying public key of the watchtower to retrieve information for.

parameters.name: include_sessions
parameters.description: Whether we should include sessions with the watchtower in the response.

parameters.name: exclude_exhausted_sessions
parameters.description:
Whether to exclude exhausted sessions in the response info. This option
is only meaningful if include_sessions is true.

get.summary:
lncli: `wtclient policy`
Policy returns the active watchtower client policy configuration.

parameters.name: policy_type
parameters.description:
The client type from which to retrieve the active offering policy.

 - LEGACY: Selects the policy from the legacy tower client.
 - ANCHOR: Selects the policy from the anchor tower client.
 - TAPROOT: Selects the policy from the taproot tower client.

post.summary:
lncli: `wtclient session terminate`
Terminate terminates the given session and marks it as terminal so that
it is not used for backups anymore.

parameters.name: session_id
parameters.description: The ID of the session that should be terminated.

get.summary:
lncli: `wtclient stats`
Stats returns the in-memory statistics of the client since startup.

post.summary:
lncli: `wtclient deactivate`
DeactivateTower sets the given tower's status to inactive so that it
is not considered for session negotiation. Its sessions will also not
be used while the tower is inactive.

parameters.name: pubkey
parameters.description: The identifying public key of the watchtower to deactivate.

delete.summary:
lncli: `wtclient remove`
RemoveTower removes a watchtower from being considered for future session
negotiations and from being used for any subsequent backups until it's added
again. If an address is provided, then this RPC only serves as a way of
removing the address from the watchtower instead.

parameters.name: pubkey
parameters.description: The identifying public key of the watchtower to remove.

parameters.name: address
parameters.description:
If set, then the record for this address will be removed, indicating that is
is stale. Otherwise, the watchtower will no longer be used for future
session negotiations and backups.
